title: Does nothing in the current US situation make sense? - Quora
tags: Politics of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Everything in the current US situation makes sense as the culmination of several centuries of settler colonialism, white supremacy, racialized and patriarchal capitalism and imperialism. The tendency of the severely restrictive form of pseudo-democracy in the US to produce periodic meaningless alternation in power of the two capitalist parties, as people seek to throw the last set of rascals out, while the corporative power elite uses its domination to make out like bandits in good times and bad, has resulted in the stripping away of any capacity by the state apparatus to ameliorate the deadly conditions of ill health already plaguing the population when COVID-19 struck. The ideology of privatization of the commons and deregulation of capitalist enterprises, and the requirement to intensify exploitation domestically and internationally in order to maintain profitability, have produced enormous inequalities and, as ideological domination has grown threadbare, required the state to rely more and more on naked repression to try to dominate and control the increasingly restive population. The US made a political decision after the rebellions of the late 60s and early 70s, reinforced by the 1992 rebellion after the acquittal of the cops who beat Rodney KIng, to deindustrialize the US, exporting US capital into China, Mexico, Vietnam and elsewhere, and to rely on gentrification, displacement and mass incarceration to try to decimate and disperse the Black population. This attempt to make Black people disposable has been met by a protracted and intensifying resistance that has begun once again to strike a responsive chord not only among other people of color, particularly indigenous societies who are part of a global network of Native peoples defending the earth and water, as well as the mass of migrants who have been drawn into the US and other industrialized nations by the impact of war, exploitation and repression in their homelands; but also among large numbers of alienated white youth who see no future for themselves under imperialism, and have been transformed in their consciousness by the example of Black solidarity, resistance, and liberation struggle. The increasingly reactionary “white backlash” that capital is trying to motivate and mobilize cannot get ideological traction in this environment and is increasingly relegated to violence and intimidation, which the highest ruling circles, reflected in the Trump-Pence administration, are trying to cultivate and stimulate, but this is simply creating new contradictions within the ruling class and undermining their capacity to rule. We are living through the decline, exhaustion and fall of the US empire. It will thrash around destructively like a dying dynosaur, and we need to learn how to build up our capacity for self-determination and to exercise our independent countervailing power.

This is what has happened. Hillary Clinton had the elites, she had the money and she was going to win the election in 2016. To make sure, she colluded with Russians, bought a salacious dossier on Trump. #@%! if Hillary didn’t lose the election. To wit, she accused Trump of colluding with Russians. She set the hounds loose and the baying lasted for 4 years. She can’t believe everyone fell for that one. But that is what puppet masters do. To double down and make sure, Mr Obama set in motion a concealment by which he would take down Mike Flynn. Flynn was the only asset on the Trump team who would see through Hillary’s baseless projections, and stop a special prosecutor in his tracks. Flynn would be persecuted for something he never did, and be hung out as bait for Trump to pardon and trap him in a charge of obstruction. Serendipity for the Democrats was the release of the COVID 19 virus causing havoc worldwide and depressing economic performance for the US economy. If they couldn’t get him through due process certainly there would be some aspect of the economic and health catastrophe they could plausibly blame on the President. They hoped for too much! Currently, the best recovery medicine seems to be to get back to work, with Mr Trump leading the way.. Then the unthinkable happens. A career police officer, in what can only be seens as a complete collapse of duty, honor and judgement, lets a black man die under his knee. Now Democrats are loading their political atomic weapon: racism. What is common to all these situations is progressive derangement to get Donald Trump out of office. They have made their best most extreme political moves and even have had outrageous acts of nature and stupidity go their way. But I don’t see support for DJT suffering. With all the chicanery and “never letting a good crisis go to waste” the public is even more sympathetic to Mr Trump. Democrats should just read the tea leaves and let freedom and prosperity blossom. Because they have been roundly beaten at every turn.

Let's find a few things that makes no sense in the whole of the nonsense. It seems like, ( Black lives matter),—While (“Sense matters not"). Well. If the current situation is supposedly a peaceful demonstration, (first of all what does it mean, why is the phrase a peaceful demonstration. Does demonstrations originate from happiness? Aren't happiness a silent, and peaceful prone, — as opposed to aggravated irritations? A peaceful demonstration to express your displeasure against your constitutional privileges, your (“God”) given dignity not to include your manhood and more. Over generations in time? Sensible? How? Demonstration over (“Acts”) officiated as civil security which is also constitutionally amended. Turns criminal and illegal, but continues, nonetheless to merit a peaceful demonstration? I'm hoping to find some sense, so far, non. Acts committed against an ethnicity,— Negroes in America,—degrading, and on top of that, made to have accepted being referred to as (“BLACK PEOPLE”) << that of a phrase -opinion- is the most appalling of an insult/put down, stay down), ever to have existed in reference to humanity. Sensible? How? Hell, would be a paradise in comparison to the mutation in creation, (a production of which your very question descends from. A historical classic originated from the days,—most (“horrendous”) term (“slavery”) days, up to this moments. No wonder sense are no where to be found. Sense -peaceful demonstration that's illogical to it origins, has (morph into a violent riots, - and on top of that in the midst of a pandemic. Sensible? How? Can reasonable logic comprehend such? Is a higher intelligence at play once again? For, what seems folly and senseless, could be genius misinterpreted. Well. Relax. We're out of the phase, “we'll see what happens " ( into the happenings. Sensible?…

Thank you for the question, Gerrit. Everything makes sense. We simply have to rely on physics. For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction. Going back many years, President Nixon caused the election of President Carter; which, of course, led directly to the election of Ronald Reagan. America famously calls itself the home of the brave and the land of the free. Hundreds of millions of these once-independent and self-sufficient gomers have meekly allowed themselves to be caged like animals in their homes as the nation’s economy self-destructed. All but the intentionally blind have seen small businesses destroyed as the wealthy multi-national corporations and tech industries flourished. Was this sea-change in the world’s societies intentional or did it simply happen because a gentleman named Neil Ferguson and another named Anthony Fauci told us all to run and hide? It really doesn’t matter. In May, 2020, the animals were set free and we were all mad. Anarchy has taken over in the streets of many cities and police were ordered to stand down and let the brutes take over. That will all change, starting today. And then there will be another reaction to today’s events. And on and on and on.

Jeez the usual wide spectrum of responses to any vague question! All those answers really show is how opposed we’ve become. No one trusts or listens much anymore. But yes it makes sense that America is torn into a jumble of factions. Each opposing group is loud or calm, angry or hopeful, clinging to the past or pushing into the future. But that’s what America has always been about. A sea of voices washing back and forth like the tide. Americans expect and demand a chance to be heard, to act outrageously, to act indifferently, to argue and agree and bond together or break apart by choice. It’s what freedom is based on. It will never be tranquil in the States, never be free of conflict, because as soon as one has ended another appears. But we’re tough, we’ve been through it before, and will again. And in the end we shall remain what we have always been, a place where people are supposed to be equals, even though we’re not there yet.

The only thing that makes any sense is the idea that the US has to change its attitude towards race. Particularly in the police forces. Holding up a bible in front of a church for no obvious reason after scattering peaceful demonstrators that have the right to demonstrate with tear gas and shields doesn’t make any sense at all. What was that message about? Seeing a man suffocated because of his skin colour doesn’t make sense. Expecting the police to differentiate between rioters and the press doesn’t make sense. Demonstrably proven false. Expecting the police to differentiate between protesters and rioters makes no sense. It doesn’t happen.

In the absence of nonsense, nothing always makes sense and may, in fact, make big bucks in both the US and elsewhere. My own situational awareness, even in decline as it is, informs me I am currently in the eastern United States, ensconced in a comfy chair on the outside deck of a sturdy home, basking in the gentle breezes and warm sunshine of a lovely spring day, a situation no doubt corresponding with similarly situated netizens wherever they may be. This makes perfect sense to me. Worldwide epidemics are unpleasant, to be sure, but they, too, are eminently explicable, as are domestic riots, misguided and self-defeating as they are. Like the wind itself, and its constituent gasses, all things must pass, as poor Gunter Grass has.

It makes total sense for those that have followed since day one - the citizen journalists that connected all the crimes - Russia got Trump installed to destroy the US - everything bad since has been connected orchestrated and weaponized - our federal government takes its marching orders from Vlad - Russia and American traitor are highly motivated to keep the power - Vlad to finish the job, traitorous R’s to avoid rough prison anal!

Lots make sense. The current protests are a natural outcome of racism and police murder. The extreme Covid deaths from Trump’s ineptness. The Economic impact from the Covid situation. And the ability to fix this in November due to our Constitution. Makes sense to me.

It all makes sense if you recognize that Trump was put in power with the help of Putin to destroy America. Whether he is an active participant in the destruction or a willing dupe is irrelevant. He was put there to damage and he is making Putin achieve his wildest dreams.

Some but not all makes perfect sense, if your trying to influence the outcome of a pending national election (by shaping public opinion.) However, it seems that what was once up is now down and vice versa. In terms of mitigation of COVID-19, it seems it may have not made sense to shut down a flourishing economy and put an estimated 40 million people out of work. All this being said, I believe not much happens by happen stance.

The American revolution was a mistake, the breaking away from the historical situation which bore it to then move into a wilderness in which it had no roots resulting in a complex situation resolvable only by a harsh cruel dictatorship. For America to dissolve into single states will be good not only for Americans but the world I'm general , Americas massive trading power broken bringing down the price of goods for everyone including itself. We are now entering into an age where the great continental empires collapse bringing into play the smaller more adept countries throwing out threads to others so as to form a balanced entity. What is occurring at the moment in the. US can not be dignified with the word revolution ; absurdity would be more appropriate.

Welcome to the age of the termite - the people who think they deserve more than they earn, on a borrowed morality that they reject. It is the height of Tranzism (Transnational Socialism), that is specifically designed not to make sense, to subterfuge those who would resist (which is why Antifa and BLM are still walking around, but churches are closed).

It all makes sense. One just needs to understand the lack of education regarding government by one side, the mis-education caused by religion on the other side and the vast pool of apathetic or frustrated people in the middle who find themselves trying to decide which side is less evil, and can they get away with pushing back against the evils without being lynched (or the social equivalent.)

Actually it does. What is witnessing has nothing to do with a protest over racial inequality and everything to do with people who, not only still have not accepted the results of the last presidential election, but fearing the results of the coming election as well. This looks very similar to the Chinese Cultural Revolution but appears confined to Democrat-run states and cities, which is actually beginning to allay concerns knowing that November will soon be here.

No! There is not nothing that doesn’t make sense in the current US situation. Not making sense is what the politicians don’t want you to see as doing something so instead they don’t no make sense and hope that you think they do not make sense because, well, that wouldn’t make any sense - would it?
Let us look at two possible answers to the Question: Does nothing in the current US situation make sense? Yes nothing makes senseNo nothing makes senseDo you see the problem with the question?

What you are seeing is an over whelming effort to dethrone Trump. The media and those on the left will stop at nothing. What they don’t understand is a majority of the American people do not like what they see and will vote Republican.

The only thing that makes sense are the protests over George Floyd, no policeman can be allowed to abuse any citizen like that. The Marxists have glommed onto the peaceful protests to run their own agenda.

Living right next door to those people. No it doesn’t. You are right. But if you go into the treatment areas of an asylum you would find nothing made any sense either except to the people who lived in it.

The dems are trying to break our country, trying every which way they can, and that movement comes from outside our country. Things here you have to just sort out and put them into perspective. California dems have been brainwashed. It began in the 1960’s just after President Kennedy was killed.
Relax it isn’t the USA the whole world has always been like this, sit down be calm have a coca cola hug your kids or your dog and be thank full you’ve never been in mosh pit

I agree with other comments… like This black lives thing. Ok who started the separating color, races again. So out dated. Like 60 years ago. We are people. All of us. The differences make us beautiful including skin color.
Does ANYTHING in the current USA situation make sense…yes, the USA economy is recovering after Communist China’s attack on it through the release of the Wuhan virus.
The US has now as their head of state a very strange person. As an outsider (non-citizen ) I can say I am not automatically against the GOP. But is this the best they can offer ?
It is quite chaotic but appearances can be deceiving! A great deal of subtrafuge may be taking place under the cover of protest.
